name: Macspell
tagline: A spell checker designed on Cocoa's spell-checking facilities
body:
### About ###

MacSpell is a spell checker designed on Cocoa's spell-checking facilities. MacSpell can function as an `ispell -a` replacement.

### Installation ###

    curl -O https://raw.github.com/ruda/macspell/master/macspell.py
    chmod +x macspell.py

### Usage ###

Check spelling of the README file.

    ./macspell.py --list < README

Learning new words.

    ./macspell.py --learn
    Rudá
    Sumé
    ^D

Forget learned words:

    ./macspell.py --unlearn
    Rudá
    Sumé
    ^D

### Emacs and MacSpell ###

To use MacSpell in Emacs, just include in your Emacs initialization file:

    ;; MacSpell
    (setq ispell-program-name "/path/to/macspell.py")
    (setq ispell-extra-args '("--encoding=latin1" "--auto-lang=no"))
    (setq ispell-dictionary "english")

Inside Emacs you can do spell checker with `M-x ispell-buffer` or change to any dictionary, like Brazilian Portuguese `M-x ispell-change-dictionary RET brasileiro`.
